column4: Hi! I wanna to format my flash disk but it give an error, plz help me, tnx
da wut... How are you formatting the disk?
: first time it's show another error then i delete this flash, now i can't format this
Try the cli way: sudo mkfs.FILESYSTEM_TYPE /dev/sdXY (where FILESYSTEM_TYPE is the fs you're formatting to, X is the device letter and Y is the partition number)
thank you, i can format it, but now i can't mount it

Error mounting: mount: wrong fs type, bad option, bad superblock on /dev/sdc, missing codepage or helper program, or other error In some cases useful info is found in syslog - try  dmesg | tail  or so
Why are you mounting /dev/sdc? Did you format the whole device?
That's... wrong -_- Well, it's possible to do it but it's not the right way around
You need to create a partition, format the partition
I don't know how that even works, try gparted
